notes.heading: Introduction to Mental State Detection
notes.summary: Explores the use of physiological and behavioral indicators to assess mental health objectively.

notes.heading: Importance of Understanding Mental States
notes.summary: Highlights the necessity for real-time measures of mental health, linking cortisol levels to stress disorders.

notes.heading: Research Gaps
notes.summary: Identifies the lack of integrated models combining various physiological and behavioral indicators.

notes.heading: Multimodal Integration
notes.summary: Discusses the improved accuracy in mental state detection through the integration of multiple biomarkers.

notes.heading: Proposed Methodology
notes.summary: Outlines a model that combines data from facial expressions, voice recordings, and physiological indicators.

notes.heading: Challenges in Data Collection
notes.summary: Addresses the difficulties in accessing diverse datasets and the ethical implications of sensitive data.

notes.heading: False Negatives in Model Accuracy
notes.summary: Discusses the risks of misclassifying mental states, potentially leading to delayed interventions.

notes.heading: Ethical and Privacy Concerns
notes.summary: Examines privacy issues surrounding the use of sensitive data in mental health assessments.

notes.heading: Model Architecture Overview
notes.summary: Describes the proposed deep learning architecture for processing multimodal data for mental state prediction.

notes.heading: Practical Applications
notes.summary: Explores applications of the model in healthcare, mental health assessments, and workplace wellness.
